name: Version 1.12.1 - Bug fix for TinyProtocol
body: In this pre-release I have fixed the issue found in #147. Please note that this is still a **pre-release** and is not meant for production servers. (Also look at the release notes for 2.12).

name: Version 2.12 - Updated setText methods and TinyProtocol update
body:
Hi all,

**This is a pre-release and only works for 1.16 R2 and R3!** This update contains updated for the setText method, which have been cleaned up a little bit. This version also comes with a conversion for TinyProtocol, which now uses UUIDs instead of player names to cache the channels, I am not sure why the original author did not do that in the first place.

Please note that this is released as a pre-release, as I am not 100% sure all issues are resolved yet. I am still testing this. However feel free to open an issue if you happen to find anything!

Happy coding! 💻

name: Version 2.11.1 - Small bug fixes and sync skin fetcher method
body:
Hi all,

This release contains small bug fixes for the NPC states (see issue #129 and PR #126) and a synchronous skin fetcher method (see PR #130).
Thanks for everyone who keeps contributing to the library, even though I do not have any time to work on it anymore. It is truly heartwarming to see. ❤️ 

I hope you have had a good Christmas and wish all of you a happy new year!

Till next time,
Jitse

name: Version 2.11 - Head rotation and 1.16.x support
body:
Hi all, 


Thanks to @Mooselk, some new functions have been added to NPCLib. :)

Have a good day!


Kind regards,
Jitse Boonstra

name: Version 2.10 - Added 1.16.2 support
body:
This version adds 1.16 R2 support (i.e. 1.16.2).

Happy coding!

name: Version 2.9 - More features, Discord Server and more!
body:
Hi all,


In this version of NPCLib a few things have changed:
* 1.8 R2 support is dropped (nobody uses it and it feels redundant to maintain it, please use 1.8 R3 if you're still on 1.8).
* Animations have been added by @MCMDEV! You can now swing arms and play crit effects..
* @RealGatt has added markers to the holograms! This means that the armorstands are no longer visible even in spectator mode. This will improve NPC-Player interaction (as you're no longer clicking the armorstand by accident).

As requested in ticket #109 (by @pluttotv), an official Discord server is created for support and just chatting about the library. I hope to see you there. :)

One final thing, I'll be attempting to rework the library for easier expansion (a new major version). This will be done on a development branch. Please keep this in mind when creating a PR, so no time is wasted. <3

That's all!


Keep coding! 💻

name: Version 2.8 - Added support for 1.16
body:
Hi all,


Quick update. Added support for 1.16 and 1.16.1.

If you find any issues, please create an issue ticket! :)


Keep coding! 💻

name: Version 2.7.2 - Minor bug fixes
body:
Hi all,

I've been away for some time (I know, I was rather busy).

In this update I pushed fixes for two minor bugs, namely:
* NullPointerException thrown when disconnecting from the server. A bug introduced by an older PR and slipped by.
* A possible fix for #89, NPCLib now blocks players from joining before the server channel handler has been injected successfully. If players join before this injection, they won't be able to interact with the NPCs and spit out lots of errors.

Anyway, that's it for today! I'm back to my exams.

Keep coding! 💻

name: Version 2.7.1 - Added NPC#getUniqueId to the API
body:
As found in issue #80, the UUID wasn't accessible via the API. I had implemented it, just not add an API method for it yet. My mistake, this has now been added!

Keep coding! 💻

name: Version 2.7 - Method additions and bug fixes
body:
In this version of NPCLib the following changes have been realized:
* You can now use `NPC#getUniqueId` to get the UUID of the NPC. There were issues with the LMCUtil class. To streamline the API, I have removed this class. Developers can now use the official LabyMod API.
* Pull request #76 has been merged. Developers can now choose to bypass the PlayerMoveEvent. Although I don't recommend this, it might be necessary for large servers. This PR included a repeating task to replace this event listener. Please take a look at the PR for more information.
* I have added a method the change the skin of the NPC on the fly. Although it isn't recommended to make skin animations with this as it is buggy, you can change it for big state changes. You can access the method via `NPC#updateSkin`.
* NPCLib no longer listens async to `player#isOnline`, this is now sync to the main thread.

If you find any issues, feel free to create an issue ticket!

Keep coding! :computer:

name: Version 2.5.2 - NPC disappear bug fix
body:
In this version, I have reworked the auto-hiding system in an attempt to make it more reliable. This should fix issue #70. If you do find similar issues, please comment on ticket #70.

For other bug reports, feel free to create a new issue ticket! 

Keep coding! :computer:

name: Version 2.6 - Tab name fix, added metrics!
body:
In this version I have fixed the naming issue in the tablist. It'll now show [NPC] as a prefix with a dark gray name on **all** versions.
Furthermore, I have added bStats into NPCLib. This will help me with motivation and I think it's just fun to see how many NPCs are net spawned in all servers.

Keep coding! :computer:

name: Version 2.5.1 - Respawn bug fixed
body:
This version is a minor update for issue #69. The NPCs didn't reappear when a player respawned in the same world it died in.

Keep coding! :computer:

name: Version 2.5 - LabyMod emote support!
body:
This version of NPCLib includes the necessary code for LabyMod's emote system.
You can access this via `NPC#forceLabyModEmote(Player receiver, int emoteId)`.

Since I do not use LabyMod I have added support out of the top of my head. If there are any issues, please create an issue ticket. :)

Keep coding! 💻

name: Version 2.4.2 - Minor tweaks and bug fixes
body:
This release fixes issue posted in #59 and #58 (fixed through PR #64). It also contains a potential solution to #57.

Keep coding! 💻

name: Version 2.4.1 - Bug fixes
body:
Hi all,

This release fixes the armorstand bug of 1.15 R1 and should hopefully fix the issues related to TinyProtocol.

If you do happen to find any new bugs or would like to contribute to the project, please open an issue ticket.

Keep coding!

name: Version 2.4 - Added 1.15 support
body:
Hi all,

I'm very sorry for the long intervals between the updates of NPCLib. I'm just very busy with my course. I'll try, however, to post some more frequent updates the upcoming months.

This update includes the PR @MrMicky-FR created. Which handles the support for 1.15.

Thanks for the lovely support!

Keep coding! 💻

name: Version 2.3.1 - Removed 1.8 R1 support and added methods
body:
This release removes support for 1.8 R1. The reason for this is that most users using 1.8, use the last version of 1.8, namely 1.8.9. For 1.8 R1 I had to shade the Gson library, which is quite a large library. Removing support for this version reduces the size of NPCLib by **60%**!

This version also includes some methods found in PR #40, these are getters and setters for the text and inventory items of the NPC.

Happy coding! 💻

name: Version 2.3 - Text update method!
body:
The long awaited text update method is finally here... you can now animate the text above the NPC!

You can access this method with `NPC#setText`, really simple. :)

One thing to keep in mind is that the new text has to have the same amount of lines as the previous text, or else it will throw an exception.

If you do end up getting an error, or something isn't working as you'd expect it to. Please create an issue ticket.

Happy coding! 💻

name: Version 2.2 - Inventory and states!
body:
This versions (finally) adds support for NPC inventory and state handling. From now on you can set items in hand, armor and whether the NPC is on fire/crouching/invisible.

The methods you'll be looking for are `NPC#setItem` and `NPC#toggleState`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10088886/67164016-5177b180-f376-11e9-8a95-6777f9c2774f.png)

**KNOWN BUG**: In 1.14 R1, there's an issue with NPCState#CROUCHING. This is something that's not functional yet.

Happy coding! 💻

name: Version 2.1 - Optimization
body:
Dear all,


This release (as proposed by @Kneesnap in PR #33) is on reduction of memory allocation and some other minor fixes NPCLib was having.

Hopefully I'll find the time to make some major updates on NPCLIb soon. 🙄 


Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 2.0.1 - NPC#setSkin bug fix
body:
This release fixes a small bug as addressed in #26. Developers could set the skin object, but wouldn't be correctly applied to the NPC.

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 2.0 - Major release
body:
This release mostly fixes the big import issue developers using Maven were having. I have also added support for 1.14 (to 1.14.4).

Some of the API structures have been changed, so **it's likely this version breaks your current setup**.

There have also been several requests for some code examples, which I'll be posting shortly after. These will be put under `/examples/` on the master branch. I haven't updated the `DOCUMENTATION.md` yet also.

**EDIT**: Example classes have been added!
**EDIT 2**: DOCUMENTATION.md has also been modified.

Hope this solves some of the problems you were having. 👍 

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.4.2 - Minor bug fixes
body:
This release fixes #17 and #14.

A legacy branch has been created for 1.7.10 (1.7 R4). New releases and updates to this branch can be recognised by the `-legacy` suffix.

name: Version 1.0 - First legacy release
body:
This (isolated) release of NPCLib only works with 1.7.10 and only has basic support.

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.4.1 - Fix for issue #12
body:
This release fixes an issue people were having with NPCLib on 1.7.10 (v1_7_R4), as it would not register the correct packet listener on modified versions of Spigot.

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.4 - 1.7.10 support
body:
This release adds 1.7.10 support (as per requested in issue #10).

Please note that NPCLib doesn't support multi-line text for 1.7.10 NPCs (yet) and will not have animated text (in a future update).

As a reminder, if you do happen to find an issue in NPCLib, don't hesitate to to contact me or open an issue. :)

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.3 - 1.13.1 and 1.13.2 support
body:
This release adds support for the last two releases of Minecraft (1.13.1 and 1.13.2). It also fixes a small bug in the auto-hiding mechanism (as pointed out by someone on SpigotMC).

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.2.1 - Fixed crucial BungeeCord bug
body:
Fixed crucial BungeeCord bug. Players would be kicked whenever NPC's auto-hide. I forgot to send an extra parameter. This bug is non-crucial for non-proxy servers, but BungeeCord did not like it. 💯 

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.2 - Minecraft 1.13 support
body:
With this release I have added support for Minecraft 1.13 to NPCLib. I have also fixed a small problem where on 1.8 the Gson library didn't load correctly.

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.1.4 - Added non shading usage method
body:
This releases removed the built-in example test plugin (which I moved to a private plugin as it was solely used for development). By removing this `NPCLib-Plugin-v*.jar` can now be used for a non shading usage method. The developer can now choose to add NPCLib as a dependency in their `plugin.yml`.

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.1.3 - Various hotfixes
body:
I'm not quite sure what I added since the last release, but I do know that this release should fix the skin (yes, again) issue for when the player joins a server. This has been fixed by delaying a packet that hides the player from the tab list.

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.1.2 - Bug fix!
body:
This release fixes the skin issue as seen in issue #7.

The fix added an extra check to the NPC spawning method and checks if the player can actually see NPC (whether the entity is in the viewport). As found in #7, the NPC's skin doesn't work correctly when the NPC's entity can't be seen by the player. This fix is experimental and can be disabled with a method listed below. If you happen to find a bug, don't hesitate to create an issue ticket!

I have added 2 public methods to the NPC class:
 - `NPC#setFOV`: This changes the FOV the NPC will look for. Currently set at 60, the *sweet spot* for the default FOV.
 - `NPC#disableFOV`: This disables the FOV check and will result in the NPC spawning regardless of the player looking at the NPC.

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.1.1 - Bug fix.
body:
This release fixes a bug that occurred while reloading the server.

This bug caused NPCLib to throw an error while destroying NPCs onDisable.

Keep coding! 👨‍💻

name: Version 1.1 - Maven!
body:
This release is mostly backend changes. The code has been transferred to a Maven project (thanks to @MrMicky-FR's help). Will soon be adding TravisCI to the repository.

I have also split off a part of the plugin to create an `NPCLib-API.jar` without the contents of the test plugin that can be used for shading the library.

Furthermore have there been a few smaller changes in order to make the library more bug-free. 🐛

Keep coding!

name: Version 1.0.4 - Quick bug fix.
body:
NPC is now removed again on 1.12.x servers.

(I forgot to uncomment a line of code - whoops!)

name: Version 1.0.3 - Small changes.
body:
In this release new methods in the NPCLib class have been added to make spawning NPCs more easy.

I also added a prettier tab list name for the NPCs with a suiting prefix.

name: Version 1.0.2 - Bug fixes.
body:
This release adds an extra check so that the NPCs don't disappear randomly.
This check works in on the Chunk(Un)loadEvent and double-checks the auto-disappearing mechanism.

name: Version 1.0.1 - Bug fix.
body:
Fixed issue(s):
 - Second skin layer not working on 1.9 - 1.12

name: Version 1.0 - First release!
body:
The first stable release of NPCLib, hooray!

This version includes:
 - Creating NPCs for 1.8 - 1.12
 - A skin data fetcher utility for https://mineskin.org/
 - NPCSpawnEvent, NPCDestroyEvent, NPCInteractEvent

Known issue(s):
 - Second skin layer not working on 1.9 - 1.12
